nodes.bodyText: I can remove the Pair, but is FileStreamSignature the right object to return here?  The NodeSignatureVerifier is already iterating over an existing list of FileStreamSignatures before it calls this, the code would either be building a second set of FileStreamSignature that it would have to merge with the original, or it would have to pass in the FileStreamSignature it needs to add the signature and hash to.  I can create a separate class to house the two values the Pair represents and return that as to have the same structure.

@@ -0,0 +1,55 @@
+package com.hedera.mirror.importer.reader.signature;/*

nodes.bodyText: Let's remove the switch statement and parse them in the order they're supposed to show up in the file. Technically the switch would allow invalid files that had signatures and hashes in the wrong order.
Agreed, took a first pass at refactoring that.
Should be a constant for hash size
Done.
These constants should be moved to this class. FileDelimiter needs to be deleted depending on who's PR gets merged first.
Moved, will delete when PRs are synced up.

The first int from the file is actually a marker with the value 4 so we should be more accepting of things until then. We should probably use an if less than equal to 4 then use V2. Otherwise throw an unsupported error. There might actually be a v1 floating around somewhere as well but it should use the same format.
Should add a comment explaining about why a value of 4 indicates v2.

I just reread the file format doc for the new format and noticed the version for the sig file (version 5) is actually in a byte instead of an int.  Just to make sure, the marker with the value 4 is also a byte, or that actually is an int?
That seems like an oversight. Let's bring it up with Qian.
Oh, actually the current marker is a byte as well. That's why we're byte typeDelimiter = dis.readByte() in Utility.extractHashAndSigFromFile(). So no oversight.
Reader invocation should be done once at the bottom generically for all types.
Done.

We shouldn't leak details of using BufferedInputStream to clients. Clients should pass InputStream and BufferedInputStream should be opened here. Javadocs on interface should indicate that read() will close the inputstream so try with resources by the client isn't necessary.

nodes.bodyText:
Shouldn't this throw the signature parse exception you added?
Also, the error message is not really accurate nor does it include the actual value. The old string seemed good enough to me: "Unable to read signature file hash". Would just add the actual value received.
Yeah, changed the exception to use the new one, corrected the messages and added the values to the exception messages.
Should add the actual size received and use the signature parse exception
Done.
Shouldn't reuse variables
Made new variables and renamed the existing ones to be more clear.
Why are we wrapping the exceptions we throw? We should throw SignatureFileParsingException everywhere and probably only catch IOException and rethrow here.
Done.
nit: format
Fixed.
nit: can just catch ImporterException
Fixed.
format
Fixed.
format, can fit in one line
Fixed.

Shouldn't extend ParserException as signature file reading occurs during download phase. Can just extend ImporterException and only implement constructors that are used. This will also help address a code smell.
